Articles.Content: So, I was playing KSP (REALLY?!) on my PS4, and I decided to try an interplanetary flyby.  I got into orbit around the sun just fine, with maneuver nodes, but once in orbit,(around the sun), I could no longer place nodes!  My ship was ion powered, so I kind of needed those.  Anyone know what's going on?  If there's a solution?
This can happen sometimes, try changing focus to the planet you want to place a node around, also try quicksaving then quickloading.

Thank you very much for your extremely quick response. (Wow). I'll try that.  If it works, will I have to do that every time my capability of putting nodes down disappears?  And, also, on an unrelated note, do you have any advice for doing a flyby of a planet?  I'm very new with it.

Unfortunately yes, console KSP is older than the PC release at this time, but I advise that you try not to crash into the planets!

Seriously though, bring as many science parts as you can in career games, and in any game type if you can't get an encounter you might need to wait till next orbit, using the O button on a node lets you toggle the next/previous orbit buttons.
I think another person asked the same question, jonfourtanately,
